title: Ndabagi01
author: Ndabagi01
content: I have a question and doubt about where to communicate in this forum since I joined. I see a lot of newbies posting in the beginners board always and not interacting in other board most times. Is this where we only belong to for now until we gather plenty knowledge here and then rank up before we can use other boards? Am I free to comment on any other boards as I do here and also ask questions there too?

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: Ndabagi01 on October 03, 2022, 06:43:49 PMAm I free to comment on any other boards as I do here and also ask questions there too?There was a time Newbie jail existed, when newbies where restricted to Beginners & Help board, but that has been stopped and would not be coming back.You are free to post in other boards on the forum (edit; except serious discussion and Ivory tower, as a newbie), and I would encourage you check around the various boards and find topics that interests you, from politics to economics. You can also check if you have a local board to interact with people from your region.Do well to check the pinned message on the different boards and child boards, before making a thread there.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: If you see create new topic or reply and you click on it and it worked, that means you can post on the board. Where I know is restricted to newbies is serious discussion board. Because someone is new on this forum does not mean he can not post on any other board than beginners and help. But do not post about what you do not know, learn instead from what good members are posting on the threads and boards.

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: The beginners and help board isn't the only board you can make a post in, but it is probably the one you can make the most noobish topics and ask the most noobish questions and it will be very well tolerated, that is why newbies use this board often when they are just getting used to the forum, e.g your noobish posts are less likely to get deleted in this section than in others, like mining or technical sections, so if you have a question that is still of noob level, ask them in this section.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Quote from: Ndabagi01 on October 03, 2022, 06:43:49 PMAm I free to comment on any other boards as I do here and also ask questions there too?They're some boards where newbies accounts are not allowed to post in, but as far as the "reply" button is present it means you can post in such board while if the "reply" button is absent then it means you can't post there. You can just roam around different boards to see what I'm talking about. You can check section like: Archive, Ivory tower etc.But that doesn't restrict you from learning and exploring the forum. As long as you're here to learn them you account rank won't matter.

comments.author: Cryptomultiplier
comments.body: The only limitation one might experience as a newbie without much knowledge on where to post is that, one should maintain consistency of being online and by surfing through various boards, you will find topics of interest to count as activity when you reply. If it is not a board you are allowed to reply on, an error message should appear or a message of notification is sent. Once you rank up, more options and directions of where to post replies surfaces. Stay consistent, and be free to explore and make connections with other members of the forum.

comments.author: Lida93
comments.body: Quote from: Ndabagi01 on October 03, 2022, 06:43:49 PMI have a question and doubt about where to communicate in this forum since I joined. I see a lot of newbies posting in the beginners board always and not interacting in other board most times. Is this where we only belong to for now until we gather plenty knowledge here and then rank up before we can use other boards? Am I free to comment on any other boards as I do here and also ask questions there too?As a newbie you're not confined to posting only on beginners and help, you're at liberty to post and comment on any of the board as long as your content is educative and tally with the ideas and objectives of such board. But for now I'll advise you focus more on beginners and help cause it's like a foundational building for you to grow in knowledge fast about so many things concerning the forum and crypto inquiries too compared to other board (my opinion though).

comments.author: Sarah Azhari
comments.body: Quote from: Ndabagi01 on October 03, 2022, 06:43:49 PMI see a lot of newbies posting in the beginners board always and not interacting in other board most times. Is this where we only belong to for now until we gather plenty knowledge here and then rank up before we can use other boards? That a point, this board frequently visited places where you can earn merit, in fact, everyone is happy with the confession.Quote from: Cantsay on October 03, 2022, 08:08:17 PMThey're some boards where newbies accounts are not allowed to post in, what board?, as I remember all boards allowed newbies to make posts.

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: Quote from: Ndabagi01 on October 03, 2022, 06:43:49 PMI have a question and doubt about where to communicate in this forum since I joined. I see a lot of newbies posting in the beginners board always and not interacting in other board most times. Is this where we only belong to for now until we gather plenty knowledge here and then rank up before we can use other boards? Am I free to comment on any other boards as I do here and also ask questions there too?As a newbie there is this fear that, where legendary members are making comments I can not put mouth. So at that stage or time now he became selective. He select where to make comments. And newbies are more in beginners and help board more than other boards. Other boards also have newbies. Newbies make comments on others boards based on their knowledge so if have a specific knowledge on particular board that you can contribute knowledge to it. You are free to educate comments and contribute knowledge to it. Newbies are not stopped only on this board boy unlimited boards but your knowledge is needed in other boards. Beginners & help is best place for newbies that just join bitcoin to learn. But if you have knowledge on others, you can go out. You can navigate to others.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: Ndabagi01 on October 03, 2022, 06:43:49 PMAm I free to comment on any other boards as I do here and also ask questions there too?Yes you are allowed to comment and post on any boards except those with restriction or limit to such rank like serious discussion. Also you can comment on local boards of your own or if you can talk with other language maybe thats allowed sincr you can write or understand that linguisitic.Newbies typically post on BH for such guidance so youll definitely noticed a lot of newbie posting here.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Quote from: Sarah Azhari on October 03, 2022, 10:58:06 PMQuote from: Cantsay on October 03, 2022, 08:08:17 PMThey're some boards where newbies accounts are not allowed to post in, what board?, as I remember all boards allowed newbies to make posts.While you were still a newbie I don't think you ever tried to make post in the Ivory tower, Archival or serious discussion .I once tried creating a thread at the Archival section just so that I could test how my post will look like before posting it but I couldn't, you can see the thread I created asking if newbies where excluded from that section  Is there any alternative?And judging from your post history I don't think you ever experienced something like that.Quote from: Sarah Azhari on October 03, 2022, 10:58:06 PMThat a point, this board frequently visited places where you can earn merit, in fact, everyone is happy with the confession.This isn't true, the board where you make your post doesn't determine if you'll get merited or not, your post quality does that. Even if you make your post in the most merited board and your Â post still turn out to be a shit post you still won't get merited.

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: Quote from: Upgrade00 on October 03, 2022, 06:59:04 PMQuote from: Ndabagi01 on October 03, 2022, 06:43:49 PMAm I free to comment on any other boards as I do here and also ask questions there too?There was a time Newbie jail existed, when newbies where restricted to Beginners & Help board, but that has been stopped and would not be coming back.You are free to post in other boards on the forum (edit; except serious discussion and Ivory tower, as a newbie), and I would encourage you check around the various boards and find topics that interests you, from politics to economics. You can also check if you have a local board to interact with people from your region.Do well to check the pinned message on the different boards and child boards, before making a thread there.I remember the days when newbies had section restrictions on comments, but thankfully that's a thing of the past because it limited experienced people with valuable knowledge to just beginner accounts. Now you can express your thoughts in any section, even from the lowest rank, which undoubtedly only benefits the forum.And yes, you can communicate in any section of this forum without any restrictions (except for posting pictures of your rank).

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Your first post is in the Gambling Discussion Thread. Also, I don't see any of your deleted posts. Why do you ask such stupid questions, then? I don't see the need to create the thread you created, as it's worth trying first and asking later. Registration is in May, and you still don't know where to go or if you need to write. Pretty strange behavior.Â If you are asking about the opportunity to write on a topic for beginners, then such questions, if they continue, are unlikely to give you a reputation. It is necessary to be independent; the forum is not a kindergarten.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: lovesmayfamilis on October 04, 2022, 06:45:42 AMYour first post is in the Gambling Discussion Thread. Also, I don't see any of your deleted posts. Why do you ask such stupid questions, then? I don't see the need to create the thread you created, as it's worth trying first and asking later. The culture of hitting on newbies, for the sake of it is quite unhealthy to me. Members ask questions based on ignorance of the fact, and sometimes can, and should, be given the benefit of the doubt even if it looks obvious to older members.Op could be asking if there's an unwritten rule about it, and even though the can post there (other boards), is it something the should be doing, or it could be a simple oversight.Quote from: lovesmayfamilis on October 04, 2022, 06:45:42 AMIf you are asking about the opportunity to write on a topic for beginners, then such questions, if they continue, are unlikely to give you a reputation. It is necessary to be independent; the forum is not a kindergarten.Newbies are encourage to ask questions, B&H could very well be the kindergarten of the forum, and it's a complex forum enough for anyone to get confused on one thing or the other.

comments.author: khaled0111
comments.body: There are no restrictions on where newbies can post (except for few sub-board). You can post anywhere as long as your comment is on topic and relevant to the on going discussion.The purpose of having different boards and sub-board is to keep the forum organized and to make accessing information easier.The B&H board is the most suitable for beginners but if you feel your post or question feets better into another board then don't hesitate to post it there. Even if you don't do that, mods will take care of it and will move your topic to the relevant section.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: As a newbie when you first register and log in you probably going to check out the home space of the forum and check out the titles of the board, I would bet anything on the fact that you would be drawn to The beginner and help section because it's relatable to your rank, so I do not blame any of the Newbie who is most consistent here.Yes I won't say anyone is limited here but beginners and help personally helped me grow, I learn from other people's mistakes and also learn from corrections that we're posted here. Newbies who take their time before posting after they have known may less likely to spam, especially on other boards. But if you have prior knowledge of other boards or have gained some feel free to explore.

comments.author: Findingnemo
comments.body: Quote from: Ndabagi01 on October 03, 2022, 06:43:49 PMI have a question and doubt about where to communicate in this forum since I joined. I see a lot of newbies posting in the beginners board always and not interacting in other board most times. Is this where we only belong to for now until we gather plenty knowledge here and then rank up before we can use other boards? Am I free to comment on any other boards as I do here and also ask questions there too?There is no restriction to post on the boards anymore apart from ivory discussion child board under serious discussion, and the reason why newbies spend most of the time in B&H is to learn and become familiar with crypto and forum related stuffs as much as possible before diving into the main board so they will get better impression from the community which will give good reputation as well as other benefits.

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: Quote from: Ndabagi01 on October 03, 2022, 06:43:49 PMIs this where we only belong to for now until we gather plenty knowledge here and then rank up before we can use other boards? No, as far as you have a good knowledge on other boards yiu can akso post there, beginners and help is only meant to engage newbies on information and urgent required knowledge and their applications to where necessary, you can ask questions here, share an informative idea, educate newbies and learn from others experience, just as it been said earlier by some members, avoid posting where your idea is less important or myopic.Quote from: Ndabagi01 on October 03, 2022, 06:43:49 PMAm I free to comment on any other boards as I do here and also ask questions there too?serious discussion board also is meant for only the experienced members to post there, not for newbies and that's the only board that has a restriction on newbies.

comments.author: GeorgeJohn
comments.body: Quote from: Ndabagi01 on October 03, 2022, 06:43:49 PMI have a question and doubt about where to communicate in this forum since I joined. I see a lot of newbies posting in the beginners board always and not interacting in other board most times. Is this where we only belong to for now until we gather plenty knowledge here and then rank up before we can use other boards? Am I free to comment on any other boards as I do here and also ask questions there too?Theirs no specific place that is meant for newbies, but anything you don't know you can ask in any board to know what you don't and the board you want to ask is dependable to the question base or the relationship to the particular boards.Some newbies have already knows bitcoin rudiments before coming to bitcointalk community, so anyone that have the knowledge of Bitcoin before joining the forum can penetrate anywhere in search of positive response of Bitcoin.

comments.author: Majestic-milf
comments.body: Everyone has answered your question but I won't blame you if you have reservations because you are new and are trying to avoid a situation where you'd either get your post deleted or be called out on it.Â Like someone said, there was a time newbies where being restricted to beginners and help but the the veil has been broken,ð.Â  I feel the forum is like the internet where you can surf through, whatever catches your fancy, you make your research and give a good opinion of it.
